required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Intramedullary Pressure and Systemic Inflammatory Parameters in Cemented Femoral Stem
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Intramedullary Pressure and Systemic Inflammatory Parameters as a Risk Indicator for Intraoperative and Early Postoperative Complications in Cemented and Non-cemented Femoral Stem of the Hip Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock:
The cemented femoral stem have impact on increase on systemic parameters.
Evaluation of the level of histamine, C-reactive protein (CRP) and leukocytes formula, IL1b, TNF alpha, IL6 and the reflection of changes of these parameters in the intra-operative course of hip replacement.

detailed_description.textblock:
Implantation of total endoprosthesis is a very common surgical procedure and is performed with and without bone cement.
In most cases during cementation of the femoral component there are changes in blood pressure, SpO2, heartbeat and other vital parameters which can cause complications during surgery.
Comparing the system parameters between the two groups and deriving these results will help the medical staff to be more professionally prepared to resolve possible complications.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of systemic parameters during and after hip replacement (Histamine)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measurement of these laboratory parameters 5 minutes before and 10 minutes after surgical procedures will reflect the impact of cements in the eventual post-surgical complications, such are embolism and other complications.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the impact of cement in different laboratory parameters such as histamine

primary_outcome.measure: Change of systemic parameters during and after hip replacement (CRP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measurement of these laboratory parameters 5 minutes before and 10 minutes after surgical procedures will reflect the impact of cements in the eventual post-surgical complications, such are embolism and other complications.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the impact of cement in different laboratory parameters such as C-reactive protein (CRP)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of systemic parameters during and after hip replacement (Leukocytes formula)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measurement of these laboratory parameters 5 minutes before and 10 minutes after surgical procedures will reflect the impact of cements in the eventual post-surgical complications, such are embolism and other complications.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the impact of cement in different laboratory parameters such as changes of leukocytes formula

primary_outcome.measure: Change of systemic parameters during and after hip replacement (IL1b)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measurement of these laboratory parameters 5 minutes before and 10 minutes after surgical procedures will reflect the impact of cements in the eventual post-surgical complications, such are embolism and other complications.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the impact of cement in different laboratory parameters such as IL1b

primary_outcome.measure: Change of systemic parameters during and after hip replacement (TNF alpha)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measurement of these laboratory parameters 5 minutes before and 10 minutes after surgical procedures will reflect the impact of cements in the eventual post-surgical complications, such are embolism and other complications.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the impact of cement in different laboratory parameters such are TNF alpha

primary_outcome.measure: Change of systemic parameters during and after hip replacement (IL6)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The measurement of these laboratory parameters 5 minutes before and 10 minutes after surgical procedures will reflect the impact of cements in the eventual post-surgical complications, such are embolism and other complications.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the impact of cement in different laboratory parameters such as IL6.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The changes will be measured 5 minutes before implantation and during first 10 minutes after implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference of arterial pressure after implantation of femoral component

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference of changes of Leukocyte formula
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The blood will be taken from patience 1 hour before and Post Operative Day One
secondary_outcome.description: Difference of changes of Leukocyte formula after implantation of femoral component

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The changes will be measured 5 minutes before implantation and during first 10 minutes after implantation]
secondary_outcome.description: Difference of SpO2 after implantation of femoral component The changes will be measured by the device monitor connected to patient

arm_group.arm_group_label: Correlation of intramedullary pressure and systemic inflammatory parameters in cemented THA
Correlation of intramedullary pressure and systemic inflammatory parameters in non cemented THA

intervention.description: The hip replacement surgery is when a damaged hip is replaced with artificial one
intervention.arm_group_label: Correlation of intramedullary pressure and systemic inflammatory parameters in cemented THA
Correlation of intramedullary pressure and systemic inflammatory parameters in non cemented THA

biospec_descr.textblock: Evaluation of the level of histamine, C-reactive protein (CRP) and leukocytes formula, IL1b, TNF alpha, IL6 and the reflection of changes of these parameters in the intra-operative course of hip replacement.

study_pop.textblock: Patients are from the waiting list for surgery. All are included in the study with their consent The femoral component cemented or non-cemented is realized based on bone quality, age and its testing during surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
The inclusion criteria were as follows:
- All patients willing to participate who underwent cemented and uncemented THA,
- With no limit on age
Exclusion Criteria:
The exclusion criteria were patients with:
- Periprosthetic fractures,
- Pathological fractures
- THA revision
- ASA IV
